name: 4-(2-methoxyphenyl)-2,4-dimethyl-5,6-dihydro-4H-benzo[d]cyclohepta[1,2-b:3,4-b']difuran
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2803
Reason: 4-(2-methoxyphenyl)-2,4-dimethyl-5,6-dihydro-4H-benzo[d]cyclohepta[1,2-b:3,4-b']difuran has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that impact its melting point. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The methoxyphenyl group (one phenyl ring) adds approximately +30 to +50°C due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. The two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion augment the melting point by approximately +60 to +100°C each. The methyl groups (two total) contribute approximately +10 to +20°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The dimethyl group (one methyl group linked to a benzene ring) adds approximately +5 to +10°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The furan ring (one furan ring) adds approximately +20 to +30°C due to increased pi-pi interactions and rigidity. The methoxy group (one methoxy group) adds approximately +5 to +10°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity.
